um ping inflating all this um ZL um every time you saw a a new cell so now
we have this thing called list view cell recycling so basically it takes the view and um allows you to recycle them so
rather than um creating a new view every time it'll take an old one that it's actually already displayed and it'll
just update The Binding context so um there's just a certain amount of views I
mean if you actually uh test it out you can notice there's only three or four views um depending on how many actually
displayed on the screen and it'll just actually um recycle them through um iOS
um it's actually sort of a technique that IOS and Android um use on their list as well so the performance

reduce nesting and layout Cycles don't put a list view inside a scroll view use the header and footer so
what people will do is they'll get a um they they get a list View and then they'll put a grid with a header and
then they'll put uh well a scroll View and they'll put a grid with a header and then they'll put the list view inside that but what actually happens is if one
of the bits of text change that are inside the the grid it it does a full
layout cycle um and the list view does a complete layout again whereas um if it's
just the list view then it doesn't have the layout cycle problem issue um and don't use nested stack
layouts when you can use a grid so a stack L is great when you've just got to stack some things on top of each other
or stack them horizontally um but um if you start nesting them so you do a
horizontal um and then a vertical one um you better off just using a grid um so
anytime you just want to Stack some things on top of each other use a stack layout um otherwise um if there's
multiple things within areas of an application use a grid and don't use a
grid when you can use a stack layout as I said before stack layout's good when you've just got things that want to go

view um so on on a grid um there's three options for for a width or height so you
can use star or you can use a static value or you can use uh an auto stay away in Auto and stick to either the

systems in two cycles the invalidation cycle so um you have a label the text
changes the size becomes invalidated it um needs to bubble out up to its parents
and then the layout cycle when it actually does the layout so the invalidation cycle so every uh the visual element
